tags.name: elvt-checkbox
tags.description:
A checkbox allows the user to toggle an option on or off.

Unlike the standard HTML checkbox it will change the value property depending on the checked status. So
it can be treated like other form fields.
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Emitted when the checked state changes.
- **blur** - Emitted when the checkbox loses focus.
- **input** - Emitted when the checkbox receives input.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The checkbox's label.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the checkbox. Alternatively, you can use the `help-text` attribute.

### **CSS Parts:**
 - **form-control-help-text** - The help text's wrapper.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description:
The checkbox's help text.
If you need to display HTML, use the `help-text` slot instead.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: If `true`, the checkbox will visually appear as indeterminate.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Checkbox Component.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Sets the component in a checked/activated state if true

attributes.name: checked-value
attributes.description: The value returned by the value property if the control is checked

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: This will be the `checkedValue` if the checkbox is checked, otherwise `undefined`

attributes.name: hide-label
attributes.description: This will hide the label, a checkbox's label is highly recommended for Accessibility reasons.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the control a required field.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-switch
tags.description:
Switches allow the user to toggle an option on or off.
---


### **Events:**
 - **SwitchChangeEvent** - Emitted when the checked state changes.
- **input** - Emitted when the switch receives input.
- **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The switch's label.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the switch. Alternatively, you can use the `help-text` attribute.

### **CSS Parts:**
 - **form-control-help-text** - The help text's wrapper.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description:
The checkbox's help text.
If you need to display HTML, use the `help-text` slot instead.

attributes.name: checked-value
attributes.description: Allows to define the value returned if the control is checked

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Switch Component.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Sets the component in a checked/activated state if true

attributes.name: hide-label
attributes.description: This will hide the label, a label is highly recommended for Accessibility reasons.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: The switch's tone (color).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the control a required field.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-expansion-panel
tags.description:
Provides an expandable details view.
---


### **Events:**
 - **ExpansionPanelChangeEvent** - Emitted when the panel opens or closes.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The details' main content.
- **expand-icon** - expand icon to use instead of the default (optional).
- **collapse-icon** - expand icon to use instead of the default (optional).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Expansion Panel Component.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description: The summary to show in the header.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the panel so it can't be expanded.

attributes.name: layer
attributes.description: Display a different background.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether the details are open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the details.

tags.name: elvt-paginator
tags.description:
Paging Control Bar
---


### **Events:**
 - **page-change**

attributes.name: hide-page-size
attributes.description: Hide the page size label and select

attributes.name: hide-range-status
attributes.description: Hide the range status label

attributes.name: show-first-last-buttons
attributes.description: Whether to show the first/last buttons to the user.

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: Number of items to display on a page.

tags.name: elvt-resize-observer
tags.description:
Triggers a resize event if its size changes.

If the delay is greater than 0, the event will trigger after the defined time.
Any observed resize will restart that timer. The event will only trigger for
the last observed resize.
---


### **Events:**
 - **resize**

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: Delay in milliseconds

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disable the observer

tags.name: elvt-mutation-observer
tags.description:
Trigger an event for DOM changes.
---


### **Events:**
 - **mutation**

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disable the observer

tags.name: elvt-avatar
tags.description:
Display an avatar icon
---


### **Slots:**
 - **icon** - Set custom guest icon

### **CSS Properties:**
 - **--avatar-size** - The avatar icon size (default: `1em`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--avatar-color-on-dark** - Initials color on a dark fill color (default: `#fff`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--avatar-color-on-light** - Initials color on a light fill color (default: `#000`) _(default: undefined)_

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: Avatar image

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
Set the username for the avatar, without an image the initials will be extracted and
a fill color will be calculated from the name value.

tags.name: elvt-icon
tags.description:
Display an icon

Icons are expected to be defined as an SVG path on a raster of 24 by 24.
---


### **CSS Properties:**
 - **--icon-size** - The icon size (default: `1em`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--icon-scale** - Scale icon motive (with transform filter) _(default: undefined)_
- **--icon-alignment** - Vertical alignment _(default: undefined)_
- **--icon-color** - The icon color _(default: undefined)_
- **--icon-color-on-dark** - Icon color on a dark fill color (default: `#fff`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--icon-color-on-light** - Icon color on a light fill color (default: `#000`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--emblem-padding** - Cutout padding for the emblem (default: `1px`) _(default: undefined)_

### **CSS Parts:**
 - **icon** - The icon container element
- **emblem** - The emblem container element
- **icon-svg** - The icon `<svg/>` element (not in mask mode)
- **emblem-svg** - The emblem `<svg/>` element (not in mask mode)
- **icon-mask** - The icon span with the mask image (only in mask mode)
- **emblem-mask** - The emblem span with the mask image (only in mask mode)

attributes.name: aspect-ratio
attributes.description: Set an aspect ratio for the icon element. The icon will be centered.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
Set a background color for the icon as a hexadecimal color code. The primary icon color will depend on the
lightness of the color.

attributes.name: emblem
attributes.description: The emblem is a second icon that will be put in a cutout in the lower right corner of the primary icon.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: The icon can be provided as a svg path, and encoded JSON or a URL.

tags.name: elvt-chip
tags.description:
A chip component is used as labels to organize things or to indicate a selection.
---


### **Events:**
 - **request-remove** - Emitted when the removable prop is enabled and chip icon remove area is clicked.
- **request-edit** - Emitted when the editable prop is enabled and chip content area is clicked.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The chip's content.
- **remove-icon** - The chip's icon.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: Chip tone (color).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Chip Component.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: If set to shape `pill`, displays a chip with rounded edges (pill style).

attributes.name: removable
attributes.description: Shows a remove action and makes the chip removable.

attributes.name: remove-label
attributes.description: A custom label for assistive devices, used in the remove button.

tags.name: elvt-badge
tags.description:
A badge component that is used to draw attention and display statuses or counts.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The badge's content.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description: Allows to modify the default padding of the badge.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: If set to shape `pill`, displays a chip with rounded edges (pill style).

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: The badge's tone (color).

tags.name: elvt-dropdown
tags.description:
A dropdown uses a trigger component to show an container with additional content
---


### **Methods:**
 - **show()** - Show the menu
- **hide()** - Hide the menu
- **reposition()** - Reposition the open menu

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The dropdown menu content.
- **trigger** - The dropdown menu trigger.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description: The hoist attribute forces the panel to use a fixed positioning strategy, allowing it to break out of the container.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the dropdown panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep
the panel inside the viewport.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the dropdown so the panel will not open.

attributes.name: stay-open-on-select
attributes.description:
By default, the dropdown is closed when an item is selected. This attribute will keep it open instead.
Useful for dropdowns that allow for multiple interactions.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the dropdown is open. You can toggle thi s attribute to show and hide the dropdown,
or you can use the show() and hide() methods and this attribute will reflect the dropdown’s open state.

tags.name: elvt-menu
tags.description:
Menus provide a list of options for the user to choose from.

! Nesting menus is not possible yet.
---


### **Events:**
 - **elvt-item-select**

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The menu content (items, labels, dividers, ...).

tags.name: elvt-menu-item
tags.description:
Menu-Items provide a list of options for the user to choose from.

! Nesting menus is not possible yet.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The menu item's label
- **prefix** - Prepend an icon or similar element to the menu item.
- **suffix** - Append an icon or similar element to the menu item.
- **submenu** - A nested menu

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the item

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Display the item as selected (for navigations)

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Set the type attribute to checkbox to create a menu item that will toggle on and off when selected.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A value to store in the menu item. This can be used as a context when selected.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: When set, the menu item will open the url if clicked

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is present.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the item in a checked state.

tags.name: elvt-application
tags.description:
Application acts as a main container providing services to its children and maintaining state.

- It has slot for basic positions.
- The `header` and `footer` slots will align their children horizontally, all others vertically.
- The `side-start` and `side-end` will be positioned depending on the reading direction
- Padding and gap have to be defined inside the slots.
- Nested `elvt-application` instances will inherit theme and services from their ancestor.
---


### **Methods:**
 - **getAsAncestor(descendant: _Element_)** - Fetches the nearest ApplicationComponent instance on the ancestor axis of its descendant.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - content area
- **header** - At the top of the component
- **footer** - At the bottom of the component
- **side-start** - At the start side of the component (in reading direction)
- **side-end** - At the end side of the component (in reading direction)

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: Setting `root` will disable inheritance and set the theme only for this container.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description:
The identifier/name of the theme. It needs to start with an ASCII letter and consists of only  ASCII letters and digits.

Setting this value will apply CSS classes to the body element to activate the theme.

tags.name: elvt-card
tags.description:
A card is a visual container for related subjects. The content of a
card will stretch if the height is set.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Content
- **header** - Card header content
- **footer** - Card footer content

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
The padding will apply to all parts of the card. For individual
paddings use stack elements inside the parts.

tags.name: elvt-divider
tags.description:
The divider acts as a separator in a stack of items. By default
it will separate the items of a column with a horizontal line.
---

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Let the divider direction matches the container direction

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Divider size adds distance before/after the separator depending on the direction.
If undefined it will add no distance.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
The padding will apply to all parts of the card. For individual
paddings use stack elements inside the parts.

tags.name: elvt-stack
tags.description:
A container for a stack of child elements.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Stack items

### **CSS Properties:**
 - **--overlap-indent** - Modify indent for overlap mode, default '40%' _(default: undefined)_

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description:
Align the children against the direction axis, the default depends on the direction.
Rows use `center`, Columns use `stretch`

attributes.name: distribution
attributes.description:
Distribute the children on the direction axis, the default depends on the direction.
Rows use `stretch`, Columns use `start`

tags.name: elvt-toolbar
tags.description:
A toolbar defines a row of actions and context information.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Content, positioned after the start slot content
- **start** - At the start of the toolbar
- **end** - At the end of the toolbar

attributes.name: gap
attributes.description: The gap will apply to the toolbar container.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
The padding will apply to the toolbar container. For individual
paddings use stack elements inside the parts.

tags.name: elvt-lightbox
tags.description:
The lightbox fill the whole window with a backdrop and displays
a content above it.

The slots are transparent by default for maximum flexibility. Card work well as
a visible container inside.
---


### **Events:**
 - **backdrop-click**
- **escape-keypress**

tags.name: elvt-expansion-panel-group
tags.description:
Provides a grouping to behave as an accordion for the expansion panels.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The expansion panels elements.

attributes.name: allow-multiple-expanded
attributes.description: Indicates whether the panel group should allow multiple expanded expansion panel to be expanded simultaneously.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A label to use for the expansion panel group. This won't be displayed on the screen, but it will be announced by assistive
devices when interacting with the control and is strongly recommended.

attributes.name: gap
attributes.description: Gap between the expansion panels

tags.name: elvt-tab
tags.description:
A tab component that can be used inside tab groups to display
the selection status of a tab and toggle it.

The component will only render correctly if used in conjunction with `elvt-tab-group`.
---


### **Events:**
 - **request-close** - Emitted when the tab is `closable` and the close button is clicked (or when closing the tab is requested programmatically).
- **selection-change** - Emitted when the tab is selected. The event detail contains the `panel` attribute of the tab.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The tab's label.
- **close-icon** - The tab's close icon.
- **prefix** - A slot for a prefix icon or element, displayed before the tab label.
- **suffix** - A slot for a suffix icon or element, displayed after the tab label.

attributes.name: panel
attributes.description: The unique (per tab group) identifier of the corresponding tab panel.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether this tab is disabled, i.e. can't be activated.

attributes.name: closable
attributes.description:
Whether this tab can be closed by the user.
If true, a close button will be rendered on the tab.

attributes.name: close-label
attributes.description: A custom label for assistive devices, used in the close button.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether this tab is selected.
This property is set by the parent `elvt-tab-group` component.

tags.name: elvt-tab-panel
tags.description:
A tab panel component that wraps the content of a single tab
inside a tab group.

The component will only render correctly if used in conjunction with `elvt-tab-group`.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The tab's content.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The unique (per tab group) identifier of this tab panel used to associate it with the corresponding tab.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: When true, the tab panel will be shown.

tags.name: elvt-tab-group
tags.description:
A control that renders a number of tabs (`elvt-tab`) and the content of the active tab (`elvt-tab-panel`).
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Emitted when the active tab changes.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The tab-panels for the tabs.
- **nav** - The tabs for the tab group.

attributes.name: active-tab
attributes.description: The name of the currently active tab.

tags.name: elvt-field
tags.description:
Outer frame of a form field, with the label and help text.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Form control
- **label** - Field label. Alternatively, you can use the `help-text` attribute.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the form field. Alternatively, you can use the `help-text` attribute.
- **status** - Show a status (like character count and limit)

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The forms label text, use slot for complex labels

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: A descriptive text for the select, use the help-text slot for HTML.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Show required indicator on label

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Show label / help text as disabled, this will not modify the control.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Show label / help text in error state, this will not modify the control.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
Group mode for multiple form controls with own labels. This will replace the
internal `label` element with a `fieldset` and `legend` avoiding nested label elements.

attributes.name: hide-label
attributes.description: Visually hide field label

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the field.

tags.name: elvt-input
tags.description:
An input field
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **input** - Emitted when the element control receives input.
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - **prefix** - Prefix icon or similar element
- **suffix** - Suffix icon or similar element
- **label** - The input’s label. Alternatively, you can use the label attribute.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the help-text attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Indicating that an element should be focused on page load

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Specify what if any permission the user agent has to provide automated assistance in filling
out the field value

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Add a clear button if the value is set

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: A maximum value for date/number inputs

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: A maximum character length

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: A minimum value for date/number inputs

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: A minimum character length

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A regular expression pattern to validate input against.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Input placeholder text

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the input.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: A step value for date/number inputs

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Input type (as provided by the browser)

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If set to `true`, the input is readonly.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If set to `true`, the field will be invalid if empty

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Automatically capitalize text input

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: Defines what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: Input mode for virtual keyboards

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the input

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The forms label text, use slot for complex labels

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: A descriptive text for the select, use the help-text slot for HTML.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-radio
tags.description:
A radio component that allows the user to select a single option from a group.

Be aware that the radio is not a form field by itself. It needs a radio group.
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **input** - Emitted when the element control receives input.
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The radio's label.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Size of the Radio Component.
Add the size attribute to the Field's Group to change the radios’ size.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio's value. When selected, the field's group will get this value.

attributes.name: hide-label
attributes.description: This will hide the label, a radio's label is highly recommended for Accessibility reasons.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the control a required field.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-radio-group
tags.description:
A radio component that allows the user to select a single option from a group.
---


### **Events:**
 - **type**
- **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **input** - Emitted when the element control receives input.
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The radio elements
- **label** - The input’s label. Alternatively, you can use the label attribute.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the help-text attribute.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If set to `true`, one child has to be checked for the group to be valid

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Size of the Radio (Group) Component.
Add the size attribute to the Field's Group to change the radios’ size.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio's value.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The forms label text, use slot for complex labels

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: A descriptive text for the select, use the help-text slot for HTML.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-select
tags.description:
A select field
---


### **Events:**
 - **input** - Emitted when the element control receives input.
- **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - **prefix** - Prefix icon or similar element
- **suffix** - Suffix icon or similar element
- **label** - The input’s label. Alternatively, you can use the label attribute.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the help-text attribute.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Add a clear button if the value is set

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Select placeholder text

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If set to `true`, the field will be invalid if empty

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the control.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The forms label text, use slot for complex labels

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: A descriptive text for the select, use the help-text slot for HTML.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-textarea
tags.description:
A textarea field
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Triggers if the value is changed
- **input** - Emitted when the element control receives input.
- **blur** - Trigger on focus out

### **Slots:**
 - **label** - The input’s label. Alternatively, you can use the label attribute.
- **help-text** - Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the help-text attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Indicating that an element should be focused on page load

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If set to `true`, the textarea is readonly.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If set to `true`, the textarea is mandatory.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Resize mode

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Textarea placeholder text

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the textarea.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Automatically capitalize text textarea

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: Defines what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: Input mode for virtual keyboards

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the textarea

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The forms label text, use slot for complex labels

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: A descriptive text for the select, use the help-text slot for HTML.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Form field name, used in form data

tags.name: elvt-breadcrumb-item
tags.description:
Breadcrumb Items are used inside [breadcrumbs] to represent a route path.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The breadcrumb item's label.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Optional URL to direct the user to when the breadcrumb item is activated.
When set, a link will be rendered internally.

attributes.name: clickable
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the breadcrumb item is clickable.
When set, a button will be rendered internally.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The target attribute for the link, if `href` is set.
This determines where the linked document will open.
Defaults to `_self`, which opens the link in the same frame as it was clicked.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the breadcrumb item is selected.
This can be used to visually indicate the current page or section.

tags.name: elvt-breadcrumb
tags.description:
Breadcrumbs provide a group of links so users can easily navigate a website's hierarchy.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The breadcrumb items to display.
- **separator** - To be used between breadcrumb items.

tags.name: elvt-button
tags.description:
Buttons represent actions that are available to the user.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The button's label.
- **prefix** - A presentational prefix icon or similar element.
- **suffix** - A presentational suffix icon or similar element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set to `true`, user can't interact with the component.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is present.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description: Allows to modify the default padding of the button.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
When using `href`, this attribute will map to the underlying link's `rel` attribute. Unlike regular links, the
internal default is `noreferrer noopener` to prevent security exploits. However, if you're using `target` to point to a
specific tab/window, this will prevent that from working correctly. You can remove or change the default value by
setting the attribute to an empty string or a value of your choice, respectively.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Display the button as selected

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Button Component.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is present.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: Button tone (color).

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of button. Note that the default value is `button` instead of `submit`, which is opposite of how native
`<button>` elements behave. When the type is `submit`, the button will submit the surrounding form.

tags.name: elvt-icon-button
tags.description:
A clickable icon
---


### **Methods:**
 - **blur()** - Removes focus from the icon button.
- **click()** - Simulates a click on the icon button.
- **focus(options: _FocusOptions_)** - Sets focus on the icon button.

### **Slots:**
 - **icon** - Provide icon elements, use `icon` property for a basic icon

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file (set as `href`) as this filename.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw. Use the 'icon' slot for more flexibility.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Use a link element instead of the button to allow for browser navigation.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A description that gets read by assistive devices. For optimal accessibility, you should always include a label
that describes what the icon button does.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Show as selected.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: Sets the shape of the icon button, this will be applied to the focus ring

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: If set it applies a font-size to the icon, otherwise it will inherit the font-size.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Target for the `href` if defined.

tags.name: elvt-button-group
tags.description:
Button groups can be used to group related buttons into sections.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - One or more buttons to display in the button group.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A label to use for the button group. This won't be displayed on the screen, but it will be announced by assistive
devices when interacting with the control and is strongly recommended.

tags.name: elvt-link
tags.description:
A link that redirects to a URL if clicked
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The link label

attributes.name: usage
attributes.description:
How the link is used, e.g. if it's an external link.
Determines the visual style of the link.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL the link is referring to

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link.

tags.name: elvt-tooltip
tags.description:
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Inner elements
- **content** - Tooltip HTML content, use content property for basic text tooltips

tags.name: elvt-visually-hidden
tags.description:
Makes content accessible to assistive devices without displaying it on the screen. If an element inside has
the focus the component will be visible.
---

tags.name: elvt-indicator
tags.description:
Attach an indicator to the enclosed component
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - Component to attach the indicator to.

### **CSS Properties:**
 - **--indicator-offset-column** - horizontal indicator offset (default: `8px`) _(default: undefined)_
- **--indicator-offset-row** - vertical indicator offset (default: `12px`) _(default: undefined)_

tags.name: elvt-progress
tags.description:
Show the progress of an ongoing operation.
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - A label to show inside the progress indicator.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: shape the component will display.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current progress, the value should be between [0, 1]

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: When true, percentage is ignored, the label is hidden, and the progress bar is drawn in an indeterminate state.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: A custom label for assistive devices.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the Progress Indicator in Circular Shape. If not set it will depend on the font-size.

tags.name: elvt-skeleton
tags.description:
Skeletons are used to provide a visual representation of where content will eventually load.
---


### **CSS Properties:**
 - **--skeleton-min-width** - The skeleton's min width value. _(default: undefined)_

attributes.name: effect
attributes.description: The effect the skeleton will have.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description:
The width of the skeleton component, it takes by default 100% of its container.
the value will display as a percentage, 0 to 100

tags.name: elvt-notification
tags.description:
Used to display important messages inline or as toast notifications.
---


### **Events:**
 - **change** - Emitted when the alert opens or closes. Note: it provides only rtl direction when the duration is set, ltr will be added later ;)

### **Methods:**
 - **hide()** - Hides the notification.
- **show()** - Shows the notification.

### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - The alert's main content.
- **icon** - An icon to show in the alert.

attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: Enables a close button that allows the user to dismiss the notification.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: The notification's tone (color).

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds, the notification will show before closing itself.
If the user interacts with the notification before it closes (e.g. moves the mouse over it), the timer will restart.
Defaults to `Infinity`, meaning the notification will not close on its own.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the notification is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the notification.

tags.name: elvt-table
elvt-table-column
tags.description:
A table column - used inside `elvt-table`
---

tags.name: elvt-table-cell
tags.description:
A table cell - used inside `elvt-table`
---

tags.name: elvt-table-row
tags.description:
A table row - used inside `elvt-table`
---


### **Events:**
 - **table-row-click**

### **Slots:**
 - **label** - Checkbox Label (for accessibility)

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The label is used in the selection checkbox (accessibility). It will be prefixed
with the select/deselect intl text.

attributes.name: clickable
attributes.description: A clickable row can receive the focus and trigger 'table-row-click' events
